p: The yield of extraction using pure methanol as solvent was about 9.437 ± 0.114%. Similar results were obtained using the same solvent and the aerial parts of felty germander—the yield of extraction was 8.24% [ 46]. Previous studies reported different yields of extraction using organic solvents with different polarities, and different T. polium organs [ 47, 48, 49, 50]. In fact, using ethanol (50%) and the T. polium aerial parts, the yield of extraction was 12.5% [ 48]. The yields of extraction from aqueous and ethanol extracts of T. polium L. subsp. gabesianum (L.H.) aerial parts were 9% and 7%, respectively [ 50].
